org.sd.lang
Class WordFinder

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.lang.WordFinder

public class WordFinder
extends java.lang.Object

Wrapper around a term finder for searching sentences for words.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

WordFinder

public WordFinder(java.lang.String label,
                  java.io.File wordListFile,
                  boolean caseSensitive)
           throws java.io.IOException
Construct with a list of words in the given file.

Words to find are added from the file, one "word" per line. A word can be a compound word (i.e. can include spaces.)

Empty lines and comment lines (starting with '#') are ignored.

Each word will be normalized while loading.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

WordFinder

public WordFinder(java.lang.String label,
                  java.lang.String[] terms,
                  boolean caseSensitive)
Construct with a list of words.

A word can be a compound word (i.e. can include spaces.)

Each word will be normalized while loading.

Method Detail

findFirst

public int[] findFirst(java.lang.String input)
Find the position and length of the first occurence of a word in the string.

truncateBeforeFirst

public java.lang.String truncateBeforeFirst(java.lang.String input)
Truncate the input before the first occurence of a found word.

If a word is not found, return the full input.

getWords

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getWords()
